intro: Tylostemon staudtii, commonly known as the Staudt's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, white, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Tylostemon staudtii is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
